intro: Alibertia vaccinioides, commonly known as the Brazilian pepper tree, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, fragrant flowers. The plant produces small, red berries that are an important food source for various wildlife species. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often found in wetland or swampy areas. Due to its invasive nature in some regions, it can outcompete native vegetation and alter local ecosystems.
